title: Mulethi: Nature’s Throat Soother
author: Harish
excerpt: Licorice root (Mulethi) is a classic Ayurvedic herb for throat comfort, digestion, and respiratory wellness. Learn safe use, recipes, and cautions.
content:
Mulethi: A Sweet Herb With Deep Ayurvedic Roots

Licorice root, or Mulethi, is one of Ayurveda’s most beloved throat-healing herbs. Its sweet, cooling, demulcent nature makes it ideal for soothing irritation, reducing acidity, and clearing respiratory channels.

How Mulethi Helps the Throat & Lungs

  • Demulcent Action: Coats and lubricates the throat.
  • Pitta Cooling: Reduces heat and burning sensations.
  • Respiratory Support: Helps loosen congestion.
  • Natural Sweetener: Pleasant without added sugar.

How to Brew Mulethi Tea

  1. Add 1 tsp mulethi chips to water.
  2. Boil for 5–10 minutes.
  3. Strain and sip warm.

Optional additions: cinnamon for warmth, ginger for decongestion.

Safety & Contraindications

Mulethi is safe when used moderately, but long-term heavy use may affect blood pressure due to its glycyrrhizin content.

Avoid long-term use if you have hypertension.

Always consult your doctor when using during pregnancy or alongside medication.

Shop organic Mulethi tea and soothe your throat naturally.
